intro: Hieracium notabile, commonly known as the showy hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. Hieracium notabile is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in temperate regions.
